title: The Mystery Revealed
shortSummary: Ephesians 3 reveals the apostle Paul's divine commission to preach the gospel to the Gentiles, emphasizing the mystery of Christ that unites all believers as one body. The chapter culminates in a powerful prayer for spiritual strength and understanding of Christ’s love, highlighting God’s eternal purpose and manifold wisdom.
timeline: c. AD 60-62 - Paul’s imprisonment in Rome during his first Roman imprisonment

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and author of Ephesians, imprisoned for preaching the gospel, who reveals the mystery of Christ and prays for the spiritual growth of believers.

keyCharacters.name: Gentiles
keyCharacters.description: Non-Jewish believers who are included as fellowheirs in Christ through the gospel, a central focus of Paul’s ministry in this chapter.

keyCharacters.name: Holy Apostles and Prophets
keyCharacters.description: The early church leaders inspired by the Spirit who received and revealed the mystery of Christ that was previously hidden.

definitions.definition: A specific period or arrangement in God's plan for managing His relationship with humanity; here, it refers to the grace given to Paul to preach to the Gentiles.
A divine truth once hidden but now revealed by the Spirit, specifically that Gentiles are fellowheirs with Jews in Christ.
Those who share equally in the promises and blessings of Christ, regardless of ethnic background.
Spiritual beings or authorities in the heavenly realms, who observe the wisdom of God displayed through the church.

outline.heading: Paul’s Ministry and the Mystery Revealed
outline.description: Paul explains his role as a prisoner for the Gentiles and introduces the mystery of Christ—that Gentiles are now fellowheirs, part of the same body, and sharers in God’s promises through the gospel.

outline.heading: Paul’s Calling and the Purpose of the Mystery
outline.description: Paul describes his divine calling to preach the unsearchable riches of Christ to the Gentiles and reveals that this mystery was hidden but is now made known to the church to display God’s manifold wisdom to spiritual powers.

outline.heading: Paul’s Prayer for Spiritual Strength
outline.description: Paul prays earnestly that believers be strengthened inwardly by the Spirit, that Christ may dwell in their hearts by faith, and that they may grasp the vast dimensions of Christ’s love and be filled with God’s fullness.

outline.heading: Doxology and Praise to God
outline.description: The chapter closes with a doxology praising God’s power to do exceedingly abundantly above all we ask or think, giving glory to Him through the church forever.

application: Recognize and embrace your identity as a fellowheir with Christ, regardless of background, fostering unity within the body of believers.
Pray regularly for spiritual strength and that Christ would dwell deeply in your heart by faith.
Seek to understand and experience the immeasurable love of Christ, allowing it to fill and transform your life.
Trust in God’s power to work beyond your expectations and give Him glory in all circumstances.

keyVerses.text: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ by the gospel:
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the groundbreaking truth that Gentiles are fully included in God’s promises through Christ, emphasizing unity in the church.

keyVerses.text: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man; That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,
keyVerses.significance: Paul’s prayer highlights the necessity of inner spiritual strength and Christ’s indwelling presence as the foundation for Christian life and love.

keyVerses.text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,
keyVerses.significance: This verse encourages believers to trust in God’s unlimited power working within them, surpassing all human expectations.
